title: Installation​
content: Flashcast is up on Wally. You can install it simply by putting this in your wally.toml file Flashcast = "synpixel/flashcast@0.2.3"

title: StepCallback​
content: </> type StepCallback = ( raycast: Raycast, deltaTime: number ) → Vector3 | Result Takes a Raycast instance and delta time and gives back a new direction or a Result

title: Result​
content: </> Flashcast.Result: { Pass, Stop } Different results (outcomes) of step callbacks

title: tick​
content: </> Flashcast:tick(tick: number) → Flashcast Configures the amount of rays cast per second

title: onStep​
content: </> Flashcast:onStep(step: StepCallback) → Flashcast Adds a step callback to the schedule

title: cast​
content: This is a yielding function. When called, it will pause the Lua thread that called the function until a result is ready to be returned, without interrupting other scripts. Yields </> Flashcast:cast( origin: Vector3 , direction: Vector3 , raycastParams?: RaycastParams ) → Raycast

interface Raycast { position: Vector3 direction: Vector3 results: {RaycastResult}-- RaycastResults ordered from earliest to latest state: { lastTick: number, distanceTraveled: number, touched?: RaycastResult, [any]: any }-- for preserving state throughout the raycasting tick: number-- by default the Flashcast instance's tick }  This will yield until one of the step callbacks returns Result.Stop
